title: Mod-02 Lec-02 Our Agriculture Practices and Lessons

tasks.task: Explain the impact of modern agriculture on the environment and water resources.
subtasks: Define agriculture as cultivation for food, fiber, biofuel, and other products.
Discuss modern agronomy practices (e.g., plant breeding, pesticides, fertilizers) and their benefits and drawbacks.
Describe the role of geographical and climatic factors in crop productivity.
Explain the concept of sustainability in water management and the unsustainable rate of water usage in agriculture.
Describe land transformation and its impact on deforestation and desertification.
Discuss soil degradation and its effects (e.g., erosion, acidification, salinization).
Explain the problem of eutrophication and its consequences (e.g., harm to aquatic life, water quality issues).
Address issues related to water scarcity, irrigation management, and their implications for food security.
Discuss the challenges of groundwater depletion and its economic and environmental impacts.
Highlight the impacts of modern agriculture on climate change and fossil fuel consumption.
Conclude by summarizing the need for sustainable agricultural practices to balance productivity and environmental impact.
